name: UIEvent
desc: An object that describes a single user interaction with your app.

items.name: var allTouches: Set<UITouch>?
items.desc: Returns all touches associated with the event.

items.name: func touches(for: UIView) -> Set<UITouch>?
items.desc: Returns the touch objects from the event that belong to the specified given view.

items.name: func touches(for: UIWindow) -> Set<UITouch>?
items.desc: Returns the touch objects from the event that belong to the specified window.

items.name: func coalescedTouches(for: UITouch) -> [UITouch]?
items.desc: Returns all of the touches associated with the specified main touch.

items.name: func predictedTouches(for: UITouch) -> [UITouch]?
items.desc: Returns an array of touches that are predicted to occur for the specified touch.

items.name: var timestamp: TimeInterval
items.desc: The time when the event occurred.

items.name: var type: UIEvent.EventType
items.desc: Returns the type of the event.

items.name: var subtype: UIEvent.EventSubtype
items.desc: Returns the subtype of the event.

items.name: func touches(for: UIGestureRecognizer) -> Set<UITouch>?
items.desc: Returns the touch objects that are being delivered to the specified gesture recognizer.

items.name: enum UIEvent.EventType
items.desc: Specifies the general type of an event

items.name: enum UIEvent.EventSubtype
items.desc: Specifies the subtype of the event in relation to its general type.
